title: PVP.net Disconnects in Queue (Client)
body:
I know this has been a popular issue in the past, and there are many boards describing fixes to frequent PVP.net disconnects, so bear with me please (I have read through MANY of these posts).

Recently I have begun to have trouble with staying connected while in queue. More than half the time (more often in a longer queue), my teammates tell me that the "match found" notification is up and I see nothing. Unless I wait for another minute or so before force closing the client, I get no indication that matchmaking has stopped (timer running, etc.) but when I do I get the "PVP.net has disconnected" notification. I don't crash, but I have to be reinvited and requeue, mostly to go through the same ordeal (never getting to champion select and eventually getting decline penalties).

I have -

* Repaired the client

* Disabled IP Helper (permanently)

* Tried the DNS settings (before setting them back to default when this failed)

* Allowed several .exe's in the League folder through my firewall

* Flushed DNS and reset IP and Winsock

* Run as administrator

I am fairly sure this is not a disconnect on my _internet's_ side as I can still talk to friends in Discord while the disconnect is happening. This is either a client issue or an issue with client-server communication. I am at a loss as for what to do at this point - I don't play ranked right now but this is frustrating for my friends and I who have to waste time requeuing until I get lucky enough.

_Other information:_
I run Windows 10 and I meet the requirements by quite a bit (I doubt that is an issue). Please mention if you need any other information. Thank you!

replies.body:
I think your assessment is correct, there does seem like there is an issue between your client and the server communicating between one another.  Since you've tried multiple steps already, we are going to need to start digging into some different logs to see where the root cause is.  To that end, make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)!  One of our Tech Specialists should be able to work with you one-on-one and get this fixed.  Make sure to include the following as well:

1) [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)

2) [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)
Any updates on this? It's been happening to me too for the past week.
Bump, this is happening to me as well and I have submitted a ticket.
This is happening to me and it had gone a year already
